title: Data-Driven HPC: Harnessing AI for Simulation
abstract: This poster presents a data-driven approach to high-performance computing (HPC) by leveraging AI for simulation. The focus is on optimizing workflow and accelerating simulations through AI-powered solutions. This research aims to improve HPC efficiency and unlock new possibilities for scientific discovery.

title: The main title of the poster
abstract: This poster investigates the potential of edge computing for AI and data analytics. It explores how the deployment of AI models closer to the data source can improve performance and reduce latency.  The research focuses on leveraging AI solutions to extract value from data residing in distributed environments.

title: Graph Neural Networks for Traffic Prediction
abstract: This poster presents a novel approach to traffic prediction using Graph Neural Networks. The methodology leverages the structural information of road networks to accurately forecast traffic flow. The results demonstrate improved prediction accuracy compared to traditional methods.

title: The main title of the poster
abstract: This poster presents research into hardware-software co-design for data center management. The focus is on utilizing remote management capabilities to improve efficiency and reduce operational costs. The research demonstrates a novel approach for optimizing data center performance through integrated hardware and software solutions.

title: The Impact of Large Language Models on Robotics
abstract: This research explores the potential of large language models for controlling robots. It investigates how these models can be used to interpret human commands and translate them into robotic actions. The study aims to develop intuitive and effective interfaces for human-robot collaboration, paving the way for more seamless and responsive robotic systems.

title: The main title of the poster
abstract: This poster presents a system for intelligent prompt engineering, enabling more effective interactions with Large Language Models. The system focuses on crafting optimized prompts, which are crucial for eliciting desired responses from LLMs, to enhance model performance and user experience.  It demonstrates the effectiveness of this approach in various applications including chatbots and virtual assistants.

title: The main title of the poster
abstract: This research explores a novel framework for real-time data processing and analytics at the edge.  It integrates deep learning models with edge computing platforms, enabling real-time insights while reducing latency. The proposed solution prioritizes cybersecurity and energy efficiency, creating a robust and intelligent system for smart integration.

title: The Main Title of the Poster
abstract: This poster presents a novel approach to translation with a focus on improving performance. The key contribution is a new model architecture designed to enhance the quality of translations.  The results demonstrate significant gains in translation accuracy compared to existing methods.

title: Graph Neural Network based anomaly detection
abstract: This poster introduces a novel approach for anomaly detection using Graph Neural Networks. The proposed method learns representations of complex data structures and identifies deviations from normal behavior.  It aims to provide more robust and accurate anomaly detection compared to traditional techniques.

title: The main title of the poster
abstract: This poster investigates adaptive learning methods utilizing deep learning and neural networks for improved model training. The research explores novel architectures and training strategies to enhance model performance.  Ultimately, the goal is to develop more robust and efficient learning systems.

title: Contiki-NG: The OS for Next Generation IoT Devices
abstract: This research focuses on developing network protocols for efficient communication in resource-constrained environments. The key contribution is the design of protocols that minimize energy consumption while maintaining reliable data transmission.  These protocols aim to improve network performance and reduce the operational costs associated with communication systems.
